title: Development of Algebra Problem-Solving Strategies Through Imitation Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Algebra Concepts and Foundational Teaching Methods
context.additional_context: Participation by pre-service/in-service teachers aiming to improve mathematical modeling skills within social studies curricula

learning_goals: Learners can apply imitation problem-solving strategies based on similarity levels (proximal/distal) with 80% accuracy.
Learners can identify at least three common error patterns in algebraic problem-solving and propose correction strategies.
Through problem transformation analysis based on interpretative theory, learners can develop at least two pairs of example-transformed problems for practical lesson design.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
